source_sentence: 佛說鴦崛髻經
translation: Aṅgulimālya-sūtra

source_sentence: 西晉沙門法炬譯
translation: Translated by the Western Jin translation of the Ascetic Dharma Torch

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在舍衛城祇樹給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Bhagavān was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 爾時，眾多比丘到時著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食。
translation: At the time, a large group of monks put on their robes and bowls when they arrived and entered Sāvatthī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，眾多比丘入舍衛城乞食，聞王波斯匿宮門外，有眾多人民，各携手啼哭喚呼，
translation: At that time many monks entered the city of Sāvatthī to solicit alms. They heard that outside the gates of the palace of King Prasenajit there were many people crying out in tears, joining hands and wailing.

source_sentence: 便作是說：「於此國土有大惡賊名鴦崛髻，殺害人民暴虐無慈心，村落居止不得寧息，
translation: He then said, In this land, there's a great bad thief named Aṅguliputra who kills and harms people with violence and lack compassion, and the villagers live and don't rest peacefully.

source_sentence: 城廓亦不得寧息，人民亦不得寧息。
translation: The city walls also can't be peaceful, and the people can't be peaceful.

source_sentence: 殺害人民各取一指用作華髻，以是故名曰鴦崛髻，願王當降伏此人。」
translation: Each of the people who killed him took one finger and used it to make a flower topknot, which is why it's called Aṅguli Topknot; may the king subdue this person.

source_sentence: 時，眾多比丘，從舍衛城乞食已過，食後攝衣鉢，澡手洗足，以尼師檀著肩上，
translation: At that time many bhikṣus came out of Sāvatthī to beg for food. Having gone there, after having eaten, they put away their robes and almsbowl, washed their hands and feet, and placed the nun’s sandalwood on their shoulders.

source_sentence: 詣世尊所，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: He approached the Bhagavān, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 時，諸比丘白世尊言：「我等眾多比丘，到時著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食。
translation: The monks then said to the Bhagavān, Many of us monks, put on our robes and bowls at the right time and entered Sāvatthī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 便聞拘婆羅王在宮門外，有眾多人民携手啼哭，便作是說：『今境界中有大賊名鴦崛髻，
translation: Hearing that the king of Kapilavastu was outside the palace gates, many people cried out in tears. They said, “There is a thief named Aṅguliṣṭacāritra in our territory.

source_sentence: 殺害人民至各取一指用作花髻，以是故名曰鴦崛髻，願當降伏彼。』」
translation: He kills people up to the point where he takes each finger and uses it to make a flower topknot, which is therefore called the Aṅguli Topknot, and wishes to subdue them.'

source_sentence: 時世尊從比丘聞，即從坐起若鴦崛髻居三處，世尊便往彼所。
translation: When the Bhagavān heard this from the monk, the Bhagavān rose from his seat and said, Suppose Aṅguli lives in three places, and the Bhagavān goes there.

source_sentence: 時，有眾人擔薪負草及耕田人，有行路人詣世尊所，語世尊言：「沙門莫從此道行。
translation: At the time, there were people carrying firewood, loaded with grass, and plowing their fields. Someone on the road approached the World-honored One and said to him: Do not follow this path, śramaṇa!

source_sentence: 所以然者，此道中有鴦崛髻，殺害人民無有慈心於眾生，城廓村落皆為彼人所害，
translation: The reason is that in this path there's an aṅguliputra, killing people without compassion for sentient beings, and all the towns and villages are harmed by those people.

source_sentence: 彼殺人以指作花髻。
translation: That killer makes a flower topknot with his fingers.

source_sentence: 觸嬈世尊，諸有沙門人民之類從此道行者，十人共集然後得過，或二十人、或三十人、或四十人、或五十人、或百人、或千人，
translation: Bhagavān, if there are renunciants and people who follow this path, ten people will assemble together and then attain their surpassment, whether 20 people, 30 people, 40 people, 50 people, 100 people, or a thousand people.

source_sentence: 然後得過。
translation: Then they'll attain faults.

source_sentence: 彼鴦崛髻從意所欲皆取食之。」
translation: That Aṅguliputra takes whatever he wishes and eats it.

source_sentence: 時，世尊遂便前行，無退轉意。
translation: The Bhagavān then proceeded forward, with no intention of turning back.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻遙見世尊來，見已便作是念：「諸有人民欲來過此道者，十人共集至，
translation: Aṅgulimālīya then saw the World-honored One approaching from a distance. Seeing him, he thought:

source_sentence: 或千人然後得過，隨意所欲而殺害之。
translation: Perhaps a thousand people will then get away with it, and they'll kill them as they wish.

source_sentence: 然此沙門獨來無伴，我今當取殺之。」
translation: Still, this ascetic comes alone with no companions, so now I'll take them and kill them.

source_sentence: 時鴦崛髻即拔腰劍往至世尊所。
translation: Aṅguli then pulled out his waist sword and went to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時，世尊遙見鴦崛髻來便復道還。
translation: The Bhagavān then saw Aṅguli coming from a distance and returned on his way back.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻走逐世尊，盡其力勢欲及世尊然不能及。
translation: Aṅgulimālya then ran after the Bhagavān, but he couldn't match his strength, momentum, or the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻便作是念：「我走能逮象、亦能及馬、亦能及車、亦能及暴惡牛、亦能及人，
translation: At that moment, Aṅgulimālya thought: “I am going to capture the elephant. I am also able to catch up with horses, chariots, violent cows, and human beings.

source_sentence: 然此沙門行亦不疾，然盡其力勢不能及。」
translation: Still, this ascetic doesn't travel quickly, but he can't match his strength.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻遙語世尊言：「住！
translation: Aṅguliputra then spoke to the Bhagavān from a distance, saying, Stop!

source_sentence: 住！
translation: Sthavira!

source_sentence: 沙門。」
translation: an ascetic.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「我久自住，然汝不住。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, I've been here for a long time, but you won't stay.

source_sentence: 「沙門行言住，　　謂我言不住，
translation: “The renunciant practices verbally abiding, meaning that he doesn’t abide in words of self.

source_sentence: 沙門說此義，　　自住我不住。」
translation: The ascetic explains this meaning, 'I myself abide and I don't abide.'

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻便說此偈：爾時世尊語鴦崛髻言：「汝聽我所說，我住汝不住義。」
translation: Aṅguli then spoke this verse: It was then that the Bhagavān said to Aṅguli, Listen to what I teach, and I'll abide in your meaning of not abiding.

source_sentence: 「世尊常自住，　　一切蒙其恩，
translation: “The Bhagavat always abides for himself, and all are blessed by his kindness.

source_sentence: 汝自殺害心，　　亦不避惡行。」
translation: You commit suicide with harmful intentions, and you won't avoid bad actions.

source_sentence: 時便說偈言：爾時鴦崛髻便作是念：「我今作惡行耶？」
translation: He then spoke a verse, saying, At that point, Aṅguliṣṭacāritra thought, Am I now doing bad actions?

source_sentence: 「於我發慈心，　　沙門說此偈。」
translation: To give rise to compassion for me, the ascetic recites this verse.

source_sentence: 即時捨腰劍，　　五體歸命佛。
translation: Immediately, he relinquished his waist sword and returned to the Buddha with five bodies.

source_sentence: 頭面而禮足，　　求為作沙門，
translation: They bowed their heads and feet, Seeking to become śramaṇas.

source_sentence: 佛言來比丘，　　即受具足戒。
translation: The Buddha said to the monk who came, That is, he'll receive the full set of precepts.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻，便說偈言：諸佛世尊常法，如諸佛世尊作是言：「善來！
translation: Aṅguli then spoke a verse, saying, The buddhas are the eternal teaching of the Bhagavān, just as the Bhagavān said, Welcome!

source_sentence: 比丘！」
translation: monks!

source_sentence: 即時鬚髮自墮猶如剃頭，經七日中，若彼所著袈裟極妙細滑，若施布劫貝育越衣，
translation: Within seven days, if he puts on a monk's robe that's extremely fine and slippery, or if he gives it to someone who spreads cotton cloth and shellfish-like clothing, the hair won't fall off.

source_sentence: 則化成袈裟。
translation: Then he transforms into a monk's robe.

source_sentence: 世尊作是說已：「善來！
translation: After the Bhagavān did so, he said, Well done!

source_sentence: 比丘！
translation: Monks!

source_sentence: 當修梵行於我法中，無憍慢意當盡苦源本。」
translation: You must cultivate religious practice in the midst of self and dharmas, have no conceit or conceit, and end the source of suffering.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻鬚髮自墮，身著袈裟在世尊後。
translation: At the time, Aṅguliputra's hair stood on end and his beard fell down on its own, and he was wearing a monk's robe behind the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時，世尊將鴦崛髻在後行，從闍梨園詣祇洹便就座坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was walking behind him with Aṅguli in his topknot, and he went from the ācārya park to Jīvaka and took his seat on his seat.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻為諸尊長比丘所教訓威儀禮節，作是教訓已，所以族姓子，
translation: At the time, Aṅgulimālya had been instructed by the venerable bhikṣus in terms of deportment and etiquette. Having done so, he explained to them:

source_sentence: 以信堅固出家學道修無上梵行，盡生死源梵行已立，所作已辦，更不復受母胎。
translation: Because of their firm faith, they leave home and train in the path to cultivate the unsurpassed religious practice, end the religious practice at the source of birth-and-death, establish it, accomplish what should be done, and no longer undergo the mother's womb.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻成阿羅漢。
translation: Aṅguli then became an arhat in his topknot.

source_sentence: 時，尊者鴦崛髻，修阿練若行無人之處，常乞食不選擇家，著五納衣人所不利。
translation: At the time, Venerable Aṅguliṣṭacāritra cultivated his āraṇī if he traveled to a place where there were no people, always begged for food without choosing a home, and wore five-colored robes that didn't work for those wearing them.

source_sentence: 時，王波斯匿集四部兵，集四部兵已出舍衛城，欲往殺賊鴦崛髻。
translation: The king Prasenajit then assembled his fourfold army and, having assembled his fourfold army, left Śrāvastī with the intention of going to kill Aṅguliṣṭha, the thief.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王便作是念：「可先往至世尊所，以此義具向世尊說，若世尊教勅者，
translation: Then King Prasenajit thought: You should go first to the place where the World-honored One is. Tell him exactly what you mean by this.

source_sentence: 我當奉行。」
translation: I will consecrate it.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王詣祇洹步行至世尊所。
translation: King Prasenajit then went to the Bhagavān's place on foot from Jīvaka.

source_sentence: 夫剎利王種有五相。
translation: The kṣatriya king's seed has five characteristics.

source_sentence: 云何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 謂蓋、天冠、朱拂柄、劍寶、履屣，盡捨著一面，頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: They are the canopy, the celestial crown, the vermilion whisk, the sword treasure, and the footstool, all abandoned and placed to one side, bowed their foreheads and feet, and sat at one side.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王坐已，世尊問曰：「王何故集四部兵，塵土坌衣來至我所？」
translation: After King Prasenajit was seated, the Bhagavān asked, Why did the king gather four armies of soldiers and dust-covered robes come to me?

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王白世尊言：「於此舍衛城有賊名鴦崛髻，殺害人民無有慈心，
translation: King Prasenajit then said to the World-honored One: In this city of Śrāvastī there is a thief named Aṅguliṣṭha, who kills people without compassion.

source_sentence: 城廓村落皆厭患之，人民分離，彼殺害人民已而取其指用作華髻。
translation: The cities and villages all become disillusioned with it, and the people are separated, and after killing them, they take their fingers and use them to make a flower topknot.

source_sentence: 欲往殺彼人。」
translation: I want to go and kill that person.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「若今王見鴦崛髻剃除鬚髮著三法衣，以信堅固出家學道，
translation: The World-honored One said: If the king now sees that Aṅguli’s hair stands on end, shaves his hair and beard, dons the three robes of a mendicant, leaves household life out of faith, and practices the path.

source_sentence: 王欲取云何？」
translation: What does the king want to take?

source_sentence: 王報言：「當取何為？
translation: The king replied, What will I take?

source_sentence: 當問訊禮敬，承事供養，無有害心向。
translation: You should pay homage, serve and make offerings without harmful thoughts.

source_sentence: 然！
translation: Yes, indeed!

source_sentence: 世尊。
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼兇惡人無有慈心於眾生類，能修沙門行耶？」
translation: Is that fierce person who has no compassion for sentient beings and cultivates the ascetic practice?

source_sentence: 時，尊者鴦崛髻，去世尊不遠結加趺坐，直身正意繫念在前。
translation: Venerable Aṅguliputra then sat cross-legged not far from the deceased venerable, facing straight ahead with his body and mind fixed.

source_sentence: 時，世尊舉右手示鴦崛髻處：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān then raised his right hand and showed it to Aṅguliputra, Great king!

source_sentence: 此是賊鴦崛髻。」
translation: This is the thief's abhidharma topknot.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王見鴦崛髻已，便懷恐怖衣毛皆竪。
translation: When King Prasenajit saw Aṅguli’s topknot, he became frightened and his hair stood on end.

source_sentence: 時世尊告王波斯匿言：「大王！
translation: The Bhagavān then addressed King Prasenajit, saying, Great king!

source_sentence: 勿懷恐怖，自到彼所自當與王語。」
translation: Don't harbor fear, and when you go there, you'll tell the king what you say.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王便往至鴦崛髻所，到已頭面禮足在一面立。
translation: King Prasenajit then went to Aṅguliputra's topknot, bowed his head and feet, and stood to one side.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王問鴦崛髻言：「尊者鴦崛髻，今名何等？」
translation: King Prasenajit then asked Aṅguliputra, What's the name of Venerable Aṅguliputra now?

source_sentence: 鴦崛髻答言：「大王！
translation: Aṅguli answered, Great king!

source_sentence: 我名伽瞿，母名曼多耶尼。」
translation: My name is Gago, and my mother's name is Mañjuśrī.

source_sentence: 王報言：「汝善自勉進，我今盡形壽供養尊者伽瞿，衣被、飯食、病瘦醫藥、床臥具，
translation: The king replied, Good man, you should make good efforts yourself. For the rest of my life I will now support Venerable Gautama with robes, blankets, food and drink, medicine for curing those suffering from hunger and thinness, bedding, seats, beds, and other provisions.

source_sentence: 無所悋惜，常當以法擁護。」
translation: There's nothing to be cherished, and they should always be protected by the Dharma.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王頭面禮足繞三匝，詣世尊所頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: King Prasenajit then bowed his head and feet, circumambulated him three times, went to the Bhagavān, bowed his head and feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王白世尊言：「世尊，不降伏者能降伏之，如來皆使剛強者降伏，
translation: King Prasenajit then said to the World-honored One, “O Bhagavat! Those who are not overpowered can be overpowered. The Tathāgata causes those who are steadfast to be overpowered.

source_sentence: 乃不加刀杖降伏眾生。
translation: He didn't use a sword or stick to subdue sentient beings.

source_sentence: 我有眾多事欲還國。」
translation: I have many things to do and want to return to my country.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「今正是時隨意所欲。」
translation: The Bhagavān told them, Now is the right time to do as you wish.

source_sentence: 時，波斯匿王即從座起，頭面禮足繞三匝便退而去。
translation: King Prasenajit then rose from his seat, bowed his head and feet, circumambulated him three times, withdrew, and departed.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻，即其日著衣持鉢入舍衛城乞食。
translation: On that day, Aṅguliputra put on his robe and bowl and went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻乞食時，見一女人懷妊，欲產未得時產，見已便作是念：「此眾生甚為苦惱。」
translation: When Aṅgulipāda was begging for food, he saw a woman pregnant and about to give birth but hadn't yet given birth.

source_sentence: 時，鴦崛髻入舍衛城乞食，食後攝衣鉢澡手洗足，以尼師檀著肩上，便至世尊所頭面禮足在一面坐。
translation: Aṅguliputra then entered the city of Śrāvastī to solicit alms. After having eaten, he put away his robes and bowl, washed his hands and feet after washing them, placed a bhikṣuṇī sandalwood on his shoulders, and went to the place where the World-honored One was seated, facing one side with his forehead and feet

source_sentence: 時，指髻白世尊言：「我向者著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食。
translation: He then said to the Bhagavān, I'm going to put on my robe and bowl and enter Sāvatthī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 乞食時見一女人懷妊欲產，然不得時產，見已我便作是念：『此眾生類甚為苦惱。』」
translation: When I was begging for food, I saw a woman pregnant and about to give birth, but she couldn't give birth at the right time; and when I saw her, I thought, 'This kind of sentient being is so painful and distressing.'

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, You!

source_sentence: 指髻，往彼女人所便語彼女人言：『諸聖所生，我從聖生以來，不自憶殺害眾生命，
translation: At the top of his fingers, he went to that woman and said to her, “The holy ones are born. Since I was born among the holy ones, I do not recall killing or injuring my own life.

source_sentence: 以至誠語，使彼女人安隱得產。』」
translation: By speaking with utmost sincerity, the woman will be able to give birth peacefully.'

source_sentence: 爾時，指髻白世尊言：「此非於彼我有妄語耶？
translation: It was then that the fingertip said to the Bhagavān, Isn't this my false speech there?

source_sentence: 所以然者，我於此身殺害無數百千眾生。」
translation: That's why I killed countless hundreds of thousands of sentient beings in this body.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝處俗時，今處聖時不與本同。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, “You used to be a layman but now you’re a sage, not the same as before.

source_sentence: 汝指髻入舍衛城於街巷作是唱令：『諸賢當護五事。
translation: You enter the city of Śrāvastī with your fingertip and make this proclamation in the streets, saying, 'Good men, you should guard five things.'

source_sentence: 以何為五？
translation: What are the five?

source_sentence: 不殺生、不與取、不婬、不妄語、不飲酒。
translation: They don't kill, don't give and take, don't eat, don't speak falsely, and don't drink alcohol.

source_sentence: 所以然者，殺生之報，以刀施得刀報，盜報增益貧窮、婬報妻婦增益姦邪、妄語報眾生口氣臭穢、飲酒報增益眾亂。』
translation: The reason is that the reward of killing sentient beings and giving a sword to them gets the reward of a sword; the reward of stealing increases poverty; the reward of sexual misconduct increases wives and women; the reward of false speech increases the foulsmelling odor in the mouths of sentient beings; and the reward of drinking alcohol increases the results of

source_sentence: 往彼女人所，到已語彼女人言：『我從聖生以來，未曾憶殺害眾生，以是真誠語使女人安隱得產。』」
translation: When he arrived at the woman's place, he said to her, 'Since I was born as a sage, I never recall killing sentient beings because of this true and sincere speech so that women can give birth peacefully.'

source_sentence: 對曰：「如是，世尊。」
translation: He replied, So it is, Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 時，指髻到時著衣持鉢，入舍衛城乞食。
translation: When the time arrived, he put on his robe and took his bowl and went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 於街巷作是唱令：「諸賢當護五事，至女人安隱得產。」
translation: In the streets and lanes, he made this proclamation, Good men, you should guard these five things so that women can give birth in peace.

source_sentence: 漸往至彼女人所。
translation: He gradually went to the woman's place.

source_sentence: 到已語女人言：「我自從聖生，不自憶殺害一人命，以是真誠語使女人安隱得產。」
translation: When he arrived, he said to the woman, Since I was born as a sage, I don't remember killing one person for my own life; it's because of this true and sincere speech that women are able to give birth peacefully.

source_sentence: 時，指髻說是語適竟，彼女人即得產。
translation: When he finished speaking these words, the topknot of fingers said so, and the woman gave birth.
